intro: Aucuba japonica var. maculata, commonly known as the variegated Japanese aucuba, is a compact evergreen shrub native to Japan. Its foliage features striking variegation with yellow and white margins on dark green leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers in the spring, followed by red berries in the fall. It thrives in partial to full shade and is highly tolerant of urban conditions. Due to its ornamental appeal and hardiness, it is a popular choice for landscaping in shaded gardens.
